intro: Uroskinnera hirtiflora, commonly known as the hairy-flowered uroskinnera, is a flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus, and is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It is often found in moist, tropical environments and is adapted to thrive in humid conditions. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
